column5: I totally understand, that started to happen to me with schoolwork. Good luck
That‚Äôs deep. My memory is shit too, apparently that‚Äôs a yet another perk of depression.
I did the exact same thing, try to accept you‚Äôve already spend the money, and it‚Äôs not like games go ‚Äúbad‚Äù anyways. You can get to them anytime you want.
If you‚Äôre able to, go outside or something. Good luck man
Thank you, I‚Äôll probably take you up on the offer.
Hey man, I read it. I liked it, especially the repetition of ‚Äúmy mind plays tricks on me‚Äù.
Shit man, same. It‚Äôs like time is distorted, where happy moments were weeks ago and sad moments were surely only a day or two ago.

Hey man, I have a quick question. What feelings and thoughts were you having before you cut? I‚Äôm so afraid I‚Äôm going to start cutting, and all my friends would be so disappointed, so I wanna try to catch myself.
Try a therapist.
Don‚Äôt be sorry man, all of us have to let those thoughts out sometimes.
Sometimes you can‚Äôt bring yourself to do stuff you once enjoyed or your interests change. I was in the same boat, I took a break for awhile, but my drives come back. Don‚Äôt force it upon yourself.
Definitely don‚Äôt self-harm. I recommend doing something you enjoy, even if you are numb.

It sounds to me like she actually isn‚Äôt really trying to get better or isn‚Äôt quite ready yet. Idk, but sounds like you‚Äôre doing all you can do, and I *really* wish I had someone like you in my life.
Same man, I can‚Äôt even get a full nights rest, so wish I could sleep for a whole day (or two).

Honestly, I want people to stop thinking just because you‚Äôre a teenager you‚Äôll grow out of it. Not only do some people never ‚Äúgrow‚Äù out of it, but also being a certain age doesn‚Äôt make your problems any less. Like no, Karen hasn‚Äôt taken the kids and I‚Äôve never gotten divorced, but I‚Äôm still fuckin sad.
Thank you for being that considerate. Literally every photo posted here, even if they are average, makes me depressed because why can‚Äôt I *at the very least* be average?
Honestly, you probably do have the disorder, because 9 times out of 10 BDD victims actually look average or better and BDD is lying to them.
IKR?! I hate how so many people are posting pictures, like the point of this sub is to get away from all that shit so *fuck off*. I‚Äôm with you man.

*Same*, what I‚Äôve started doing now is actually mentally playing out typical conversations in my head to prepare myself for those kinds of interactions. Makes it so I have to do less thinking on the spot.
Lmao. I mean, I find both kinda shitty in general, so it works either way I suppose.
I have a couple close friends, but that‚Äôs about it. One of them is useless emotionally wise, the other has their own problems. My parents don‚Äôt/won‚Äôt understand. I just feel *so damn alone*.

I can relate hardcore. My friend called me ‚Äúlazy‚Äù and I actually considered considered totally cutting contact for a bit. It‚Äôs becoming a annual event for me to not socialize with any of my friends for a week sometimes. Sometimes I just don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs worth all the pain and effort that goes in to socialization.

When I need to cry but can‚Äôt, I *soak* myself in the feeling. An example being loneliness. I had been sad for an hour or two, got tired of being sad, so I did everything in my power to cry. Played sad music, let what I was sad about control my mind, and finally, started beating myself up *outloud* verbally.
Yeah, I know. It sucks :/
Talk to a therapist please, that‚Äôs not a healthy body weight for your height.
That sounds like BDD. Talk to a therapist.
I can kind of relate, my parents don‚Äôt really understand the severity of how much I hate my appearance and how it always seems to be different. They may as well not know.
I don‚Äôt know if this counts as a treatment, but not going on social media‚Äôs where people show-boat themselves helps a lot. Staying away from mirrors and cameras helps as well.

It‚Äôs going to suck dick but you‚Äôre just gonna have to go out and talk to people. Start with people that ‚Äúreach out‚Äù first, such as a cashier asking how your day was. Instead of letting the conversation taper off, keep it going in tell you leave. Work your way up from there.
That but I do it with multiple emotions.
That looks really cool, I like the necklace :)
Kind of late to the party, but *holy shit s a m e*. I only get called ‚Äúpretty‚Äù or ‚Äúcute‚Äù which is just the nice way of saying you aren‚Äôt beautiful? If ya know what I mean?

I do somewhat the same thing, like I worry me reading one article on something inherently ‚Äúbad‚Äù will make me automatically agree with the bad thing, despite knowing there‚Äôs no logical way that‚Äôll happen.

I relate to *all* of this, like it makes me feel needy and attention seeking if I actually open up and talk about what‚Äôs going on in my head. Every time I try to, afterwards I feel guilty and like scum.
Don‚Äôt do it man, I‚Äôm in almost the exact same boat but it‚Äôs honestly better to look like a bonified 8 yr old then be un-healthy, because at least looking like an 8 yr old you‚Äôre healthy.
Well, I‚Äôd first communicate with your boyfriend about how you feel about people taking pictures of you. After that, maybe try therapy?
My suggestion? Either try to find a stall to change, or just go as fast as possible changing. If it‚Äôs allowed, you can just wear your gym clothes over your regular clothes.
It sounds like the Tinder dude isn‚Äôt the one, he‚Äôs not interested move on. The 14 yr old guy? Piece of trash, and I can guarantee he was just lying to try to get to you.

I don‚Äôt sing, but I do get kinda depressed when I hear other girls have such, idk, like, husky and seductive voices. I have a very child-ish voice that for some reason attempts to go ‚Äúlow‚Äù if I‚Äôm speaking at a slightly quieter volume, like I can *feel* the vocal cords moving? vibrating? Whatever it is it‚Äôs weird and I‚Äôm almost 100% sure it sounds like a 12 yr old pre-pubescent boy trying to sound ‚Äúmanly‚Äù.

Breathing exercises, such as the breath in for 4, hold for 7, let out for 8.

Finding a smooth object to rub my thumb on in circles and mediating

Talking to someone trusted to sort out what‚Äôs up

Hope this helped OP, good luck on the test!

Definitely understand how it can be hard to express over texting, half my jokes can be taken *very* badly over text. I‚Äôm a bit worried though if the date doesn‚Äôt go well, because she‚Äôs already wanting to do a double date with some pals.
Yeah, that‚Äôs what I was thinking. Problem is she already wants to do a double date with two of my other friends after this one üòû
Thanks, I may actually use that exact line if things go as I expect.
Don‚Äôt worry, I plan to be. Thanks for the reminder though.
Yeah, that‚Äôs why I accepted the date despite my worries. Worst case scenario I just got to man up and say what I feel, but nevertheless I should try to enjoy the date.
Thanks for calling me out, because yeah, I am overthinking it aren‚Äôt I? I‚Äôm just gonna enjoy the date and take it from there.
Throat feeling like it‚Äôs closing, fast heartbeat, shaking, sweating and irregular breathing.
Sometimes I think it‚Äôs even worse to have a pretty great life and be depressed, because then it‚Äôs like you *don‚Äôt have any right to be sad or anxious*.
‚Äúall the little shit feels so big‚Äù spoke to me on a whole ‚Äònother level.
I eat way to much then feel horrible and don‚Äôt eat the next day.

Hey, fellow teen here. I was a ‚Äúearly bloomer‚Äù and for a white girl I have a ‚Äúnice hourglass figure‚Äù(-My friends) but you know what sucks? I still hate my appearance, look like a 5 yr old with a woman‚Äôs body and think I look ugly as fuck. No matter what you look like BDD is still going to lie to you and say your ugly and play tricks with your mind. I really don‚Äôt have any tips besides just avoiding the scale. What‚Äôs gonna happen is gonna happen. (That and get a therapist, being a teen is bullshit and I hate it, and it‚Äôs nice to have someone to vent to that I know won‚Äôt judge.)
You may have to be *very* strict with your calorie intake. It‚Äôs going to be rough probably but it‚Äôs physically impossible for your body to hold on to weight at a deficit (or you‚Äôd die).
AHHH, I do this all the time. Sometimes I disappoint myself with them because I know they‚Äôll never happen in reality.
There shouldn‚Äôt be much interaction, I‚Äôd google it if you‚Äôre worried.

I don‚Äôt think your boss quite understands how anxiety attacks work. I‚Äôd *respectfully* confront him about this and ask him if he understands what they truly are. (Sidenote, it sounds like those are panic attacks you are experiencing and not anxiety attacks. Anxiety attacks are a bit more mellow but damn do they still suck.)
Agreed, and happy someone‚Äôs calling them out on it.

Holy heck, I can relate. I just jokingly write it off as me being dyslexic. (I know that‚Äôs not how dyslexia works, it‚Äôs just for the ‚Äúhaha funny‚Äù and to distract people from my speaking issues)

The manager sounds like a pretty chill dude, and he hasn‚Äôt had a problem yet. He may just think you have the flu and no one wants someone with the flu in the workplace. Try to think of it as ‚ÄúIf he has a problem with it he‚Äôll tell me, otherwise everything‚Äôs fine. It‚Äôs just anxiety.‚Äù
*Holy shit*, that‚Äôs exactly what I do. Then I over do it and get a anxiety attack while hanging out with friends.
Respect.

I‚Äôm going to do a list for ease of reading.

.  Exercise

.  Diet

.  Sleep

.  Meditation

.  Journaling

.  Confidence

.  Self-care

To be honest, I don‚Äôt if it ever goes away. What I am 100% sure about is that suicide is *not* an option. That shit ain‚Äôt good dawg. I‚Äôm in the ‚Äúugly‚Äù boat with you, I obsess in silence and hate my appearance one day and have come to terms with it the next. My recommendation is just to make the best of it man, be fit and healthy and show off your best.

It‚Äôs actually a symptom of BDD to stare at yourself in mirrors. I do the same thing, it‚Äôs like I‚Äôm transfixed on my flaws for 10 minutes straight. I‚Äôve just started avoiding mirrors all together now to be honest.
Yep, I relate. Not really in a ‚ÄúI would to worry anymore way‚Äù but more of a ‚ÄúIt‚Äôd look so much better‚Äù sort of way.
I get highkey nausea but then my go-to stress response is to eat so it‚Äôs...messy.

Listen, I‚Äôm the genetic cluster-fuck of all the traits of my parents. Allergic to everything, sensitive skin, hyperactive immune system, weirdly proportioned body, no jaw line, unibrow, I gain weight easily, my ears are weirdly small, I have chubby cheeks, I‚Äôm constantly blushing, etc. It‚Äôs depressing to think about it, but you know what? I try my hardest to make the best of what I got. I workout, eat healthy, working on making my wardrobe better, put on lotion for my skin etc. Life‚Äôs unfair and it screwed us over, but we gotta try, right?
I‚Äôd suggest avoiding all mirrors, but that‚Äôs because those 10 mins spent checking myself out in them adds up *quickly*. That and it‚Äôs a bit depressing.
That‚Äôs a really well worded response, thank you :)
I feel the pain. Every time I even *notice* guys existing I get called gay.
